page.title: 17A Farm Visit in Kirkby
page.content: At{Busby farm}the buildings are made of stone and brick. The sheds, made of wood and corrugated iron, house cow kennels and are storerooms for hay. Animals on the farm includes Chickens, Cows, Calves and Sheep. One of the farm buildings housed a 450 l. milk tank.There are hay sheds, stables and barns, rotavators, combine- harvesters, tractors, bailers and grasscutters.The silage is heaped up in round bales to store it for winter.It is stored in large sheds with a black polythene sheet over it,covered by tyres. The farm machinery is used throughout year to reduce work for the farmer. Old machinery is just left around the farm.
